txt: What I mean by this is most statements about Asian culture or Chinese culture were blanket statements. 'Asians are good at __', 'Asians look like __', 'Chinese food is __'. These blanks were filled in with pretty generic information, usually based on stereotypes.

The strokes in Chop Suey font glyphs are meant to imitate the brush strokes of Chinese calligraphy characters. Chinese calligraphic strokes can be generally categorized into 8 different types: heng, dian, pie, na, shu, you, wan, and ti. Chop Suey fonts only utilize ti and na strokes, and therefore doesnâ€™t capture the full likeness of Chinese calligraphy characters
